title: HDAnalyzeR
text: First, load package‚Äôs example_data example_metadata. üìì real-world scenarios, load data metadata files instead using example dataset. order run package without issues, make sure data include following columns: DAid, Assay , NPX, metadata include following columns: DAid Disease. Also, Sex column metadata, data encoded M F.
code: head(example_data) #>      DAid    Sample  OlinkID UniProt  Assay           Panel        NPX #> 1 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID21311  Q9BTE6 AARSD1        Oncology  3.3903461 #> 2 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID21280  P00519   ABL1        Oncology  2.7588517 #> 3 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID21269  P09110  ACAA1        Oncology  1.7070090 #> 4 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID20159  P16112   ACAN Cardiometabolic  0.0332709 #> 5 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID20105  Q9BYF1   ACE2 Cardiometabolic  1.7553590 #> 6 DA00001 AML_syn_1 OID20124  Q15067  ACOX1 Cardiometabolic -0.9192835 #>   Assay_Warning QC_Warning PlateID #> 1          PASS       PASS  Run001 #> 2          PASS       PASS  Run001 #> 3          PASS       PASS  Run001 #> 4          PASS       PASS  Run001 #> 5          PASS       PASS  Run001 #> 6          PASS       PASS  Run001 head(example_metadata) #>      DAid    Sample Disease   Stage Grade Sex Age  BMI Cohort #> 1 DA00001 AML_syn_1     AML       2  <NA>   F  76 25.8   UCAN #> 2 DA00002 AML_syn_2     AML Unknown  <NA>   M  55 23.7   UCAN #> 3 DA00003 AML_syn_3     AML       2  <NA>   F  51 33.2   UCAN #> 4 DA00004 AML_syn_4     AML Unknown  <NA>   M  86 32.4   UCAN #> 5 DA00005 AML_syn_5     AML       2  <NA>   F  69 32.8   UCAN #> 6 DA00006 AML_syn_6     AML Unknown  <NA>   M  88 29.5   UCAN

title: HDAnalyzeR
text: qc_summary_data() provides comprehensive summary input dataset. check column types, calculate percentage NAs column row, perform normality tests different Assays, calculate protein-protein correlations, create heatmap correlations. Users can also specify threshold reporting protein-protein correlations.
code: qc_data <- qc_summary_data(example_data, wide = FALSE, threshold = 0.7) #> [1] "Summary:" #> [1] "Note: In case of long output, only the first 10 rows are shown. title: HDAnalyzeR
text: saw QC results, data contains NAs issues need addressed. clean_data() preprocesses dataset filtering rows based specified criteria. case keep data Assay_Warning ‚ÄúPASS‚Äù DAid, Assay NPX columns.
code: clean_data <- clean_data(example_data,                           keep_cols = c("DAid", "Assay", "NPX"),                          filter_assay_warning = TRUE) head(clean_data) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 3 #>   DAid    Assay      NPX #>   <chr>   <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 DA00001 AARSD1  3.39   #> 2 DA00001 ABL1    2.76   #> 3 DA00001 ACAA1   1.71   #> 4 DA00001 ACAN    0.0333 #> 5 DA00001 ACE2    1.76   #> 6 DA00001 ACOX1  -0.919

title: HDAnalyzeR
text: case, clean_metadata() preprocesses metadata just keeping specified columns.
code: clean_metadata <- clean_metadata(example_metadata,                                   keep_cols = c("DAid", "Disease", "Sex", "Age")) head(clean_metadata) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 4 #>   DAid    Disease Sex     Age #>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr> <dbl> #> 1 DA00001 AML     F        76 #> 2 DA00002 AML     M        55 #> 3 DA00003 AML     F        51 #> 4 DA00004 AML     M        86 #> 5 DA00005 AML     F        69 #> 6 DA00006 AML     M        88

title: HDAnalyzeR
text: data cleaned, recommend transforming tidy format (wide format) ‚Äôs already form. generate_df() create us wide Olink dataset well joined metadata dataset. üìì HDAnalyzeR can work long format data, functions transform wide format, can slightly slow pipeline. Thus, starting tidy data advisable.
code: dfs <- generate_df(clean_data,                     clean_metadata,                     metadata_cols = c("DAid", "Disease", "Sex", "Age"),                     save = FALSE)  wide_data <- dfs$wide_data head(wide_data) #> # title: HDAnalyzeR
text: Next, impute missing values using K-nearest neighbors (KNN) 3 neighbors via impute_knn(). imputation, run Principal Component Analysis (PCA) via do_pca() Uniform Manifold Approximation Projection (UMAP) via do_umap() check outliers, batch effects, potential issues.    perform another QC check ensure everything expected cleaning imputing data.
code: imputed_data <- impute_knn(wide_data,                             k = 3,                            exclude_cols = c("DAid"),                            show_na_percentage = FALSE) head(imputed_data) #> # A tibble: 6 √ó 101 #>   DAid    AARSD1  ABL1   ACAA1    ACAN    ACE2  ACOX1   ACP5  ACP6 ACTA2   ACTN4 #>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1 DA00001   3.39  2.76  1.71    0.0333  1.76   -0.919 1.54   2.15  2.81   0.742  #> 2 DA00002   1.42  1.25 -0.0721 -0.459   0.826  -0.902 0.647  1.30  0.798 -0.0659 #> 3 DA00003   3.80  2.82  2.35    0.989  -0.0218  0.330 1.37   0.561 1.34   0.737  #> 4 DA00004   3.41  3.38  1.69    0.262   1.52    1.86  0.841  0.582 1.70   0.108  #> 5 DA00005   5.01  5.05  0.128   0.401  -0.933  -0.584 0.0265 1.16  2.73   0.350  #> 6 DA00006   6.83  1.18 -1.74   -0.156   1.53   -0.721 0.620  0.527 0.772  0.229  #> # title: HDAnalyzeR
text: run differential expression analysis identify potential biomarkers. use do_limma() able correct also Age. method help us pinpoint proteins significantly different conditions. present results AML (Acute Myeloid Leukemia).  can also summarize results via plot_de_summary().
code: de_res <- do_limma(imputed_data,                     clean_metadata,                    correct = c("Sex", "Age"),                    correct_type = c("factor", "numeric"),                    only_female = c("BRC", "OVC", "CVX", "ENDC"),                    only_male = "PRC")  de_res$de_results$AML #> # A tibble: 100 √ó 11 #>    Assay    logFC   CI.L   CI.R AveExpr     t  P.Value adj.P.Val     B Disease #>    <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl> <chr>   #>  1 AZU1     1.57   1.27   1.87   0.230  10.3  5.75e-23  5.75e-21 41.3  AML     #>  2 ADA      1.40   1.12   1.68   0.926   9.83 3.06e-21  1.53e-19 37.3  AML     #>  3 APBB1IP  1.15   0.859  1.44  -0.250   7.82 2.49e-14  8.28e-13 21.7  AML     #>  4 APEX1    1.44   1.07   1.81   0.521   7.56 1.49e-13  3.73e-12 19.9  AML     #>  5 ANGPT1  -1.66  -2.12  -1.20   1.72   -7.12 3.10e-12  6.19e-11 16.9  AML     #>  6 ARTN     0.845  0.589  1.10   0.420   6.48 1.91e-10  3.18e- 9 12.9  AML     #>  7 ADGRG1   1.15   0.792  1.50   1.53    6.37 3.86e-10  5.52e- 9 12.2  AML     #>  8 ANGPT2   0.693  0.439  0.947  0.912   5.36 1.20e- 7  1.50e- 6  6.61 AML     #>  9 AGRP     0.736  0.438  1.03   0.0232  4.85 1.59e- 6  1.76e- 5  4.14 AML     #> 10 APP     -0.789 -1.11  -0.464  1.16   -4.77 2.37e- 6  2.37e- 5  3.74 AML     #> # ‚Ñπ 90 more rows #> # ‚Ñπ 1 more variable: sig <chr>  de_res$volcano_plots$AML #> Warning: ggrepel: 10 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider #> increasing max.overlaps plot_de_summary(de_res, disease_palette = "cancers12") #> $de_barplot #>  #> $upset_plot_up #>  #> $upset_plot_down

title: HDAnalyzeR
text: addition differential expression analysis, use Lasso machine learning classification model identify significant features. model help us understand proteins predictive conditions studied. present results AML.     can get visual summary results via plot_features_summary() .
code: lasso_res <- do_elnet(imputed_data,                        clean_metadata,                        only_female = c("BRC", "OVC", "CVX", "ENDC"),                       only_male = "PRC",                       exclude_cols = c("Sex", "Age"),                       type = "lasso",                       palette = "cancers12",                       subtitle = c("accuracy",                                     "sensitivity",                                     "specificity",                                     "auc",                                     "features",                                    "top-features"),                       nfeatures = 12,                       points = FALSE) #> Joining with `by = join_by(DAid)` #> Warning: Too little data to stratify. #> ‚Ä¢ Resampling will be unstratified. #> Sets and groups are ready. title: HDAnalyzeR
text: final step involves searching literature proteins identified differential expression ML model significant features, providing comprehensive overview potential biomarkers. search literature 5 AML biomarkers request 5 articles per protein. üìì Remember data dummy-dataset fake data.
code: # Extract the proteins identified by both DE and Lasso de_proteins <- de_res$de_results$AML |>    dplyr::filter(sig == "significant up" | sig == "significant down") |>    dplyr::pull(Assay)  lasso_proteins <- lasso_res$AML$var_imp_res$features |>    dplyr::filter(Scaled_Importance > 0) |>    dplyr::pull(Variable)  intersect_proteins <- list(   "Acute Myeloid Leukemia" = intersect(de_proteins, lasso_proteins)[1:5] )  # Search the literature for these proteins search_results <- literature_search(intersect_proteins, max_articles = 5) #> Searching for articles on ADA and Acute Myeloid Leukemia #> Searching for articles on APEX1 and Acute Myeloid Leukemia #> Searching for articles on ANGPT1 and Acute Myeloid Leukemia #> Searching for articles on ARTN and Acute Myeloid Leukemia #> Searching for articles on ADGRG1 and Acute Myeloid Leukemia search_results$`Acute Myeloid Leukemia`$ADA #>       pmid         First_author year                            journal #> 1 38683495       Maris, Michael 2024                  Targeted oncology #> 2 38588464 Gaumond, Simonetta I 2024                         Oncotarget #> 3 38494922        Narayan, Rupa 2024 Clinical and translational science #> 4 38085423            Wang, Yue 2024          Investigational new drugs #> 5 37951201         Li, Xue-Ping 2023   International immunopharmacology #>                                                                                                                                                      title #> 1 ASCT2-Targeting Antibody-Drug Conjugate MEDI7247 in Adult Patients with Relapsed/Refractory Hematological Malignancies: A First-in-Human, Phase 1 Study. #> 2                                            Exploring the role of GHRH antagonist MIA-602 in overcoming Doxorubicin-resistance in acute myeloid leukemia. #> 3 First-in-human study of JNJ-67571244, a CD33 × CD3 bispecific antibody, in relapsed/refractory acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome. #> 4                             Synergistic effect of adavosertib and fimepinostat on acute myeloid leukemia cells by enhancing the induction of DNA damage. #> 5                             Single-cell RNA-seq reveals novel immune-associated biomarkers for predicting prognosis in AML patients with RUNX1::RUNX1T1.

what: HDA Internal Package for Streamed-line Proteomics Analysis
title: HDA Internal Package for Streamed-line Proteomics Analysis
text: HDAnalyzeR R package developed Human Disease Blood Atlas project, designed facilitate proteomics analysis biomarker selection blood plasma samples. offers ready--use functions common proteomics tasks protein differential expression analysis, classification models, imputation methods, dimensionality reduction, data visualization, aiming streamline workflows enhance standardization efficiency biomarker discovery disease research.

title: HDA Internal Package for Streamed-line Proteomics Analysis
text: [!CAUTION] recommend install toy environment currently development. can install latest version HDAnalyzeR GitHub:

what: Elastic net classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_elnet
title: Elastic net classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_elnet
text: do_elnet() runs elastic net classification model pipeline. splits data training test sets, creates class-balanced case-control groups, fits model. also performs hyperparameter optimization, fits best model, tests , plots useful feature variable importance.

title: Elastic net classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_elnet
code: do_elnet(   olink_data,   metadata,   wide = TRUE,   only_female = NULL,   only_male = NULL,   exclude_cols = "Sex",   ratio = 0.75,   type = "lasso",   cv_sets = 5,   grid_size = 10,   ncores = 4,   hypopt_vis = TRUE,   palette = NULL,   vline = TRUE,   subtitle = c("accuracy", "sensitivity", "specificity", "auc", "features",     "top-features", "mixture"),   nfeatures = 9,   points = T,   seed = 123 )

title: Elastic net classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_elnet
text: olink_data Olink data. metadata Metadata. wide Whether data wide format. Default TRUE. only_female Vector diseases female specific. Default NULL. only_male Vector diseases male specific. Default NULL. exclude_cols Columns exclude data model tuned. Default "Sex". ratio Ratio training data test data. Default 0.75. type Type regularization. Default "lasso". options "ridge" "elnet". cv_sets Number cross-validation sets. Default 5. grid_size Size hyperparameter optimization grid. Default 10. ncores Number cores use parallel processing. Default 4. hypopt_vis Whether visualize hyperparameter optimization results. Default TRUE. palette color palette plot. character, one palettes get_hpa_palettes(). Default NULL. vline Whether add vertical line 50% importance. Default TRUE. subtitle Vector subtitle elements include plot. Default list . nfeatures Number top features include boxplot. Default 9. points Whether add points boxplot. Default TRUE. seed Seed reproducibility. Default 123.

title: Elastic net classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_elnet
text: list results disease. list contains: hypopt_res: Hyperparameter optimization results. finalfit_res: Final model fitting results. testfit_res: Test model fitting results. var_imp_res: Variable importance results.

what: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
title: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
text: do_limma() performs differential expression analysis using limma package. can correct results metadata columns like Sex, Age, BMI. output tibble includes logFC, p-values, well FDR adjusted p-values. function removes NAs columns used correct . can generate save volcano plots.

title: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
code: do_limma(   olink_data,   metadata,   correct = c("Sex", "Age"),   correct_type = c("factor", "numeric"),   wide = TRUE,   only_female = NULL,   only_male = NULL,   volcano = TRUE,   pval_lim = 0.05,   logfc_lim = 0,   top_up_prot = 40,   top_down_prot = 10,   palette = "diff_exp",   subtitle = TRUE,   save = FALSE )

title: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
text: olink_data tibble Olink data wide format. metadata tibble metadata. correct variables correct results . Default c("Sex", "Age"). correct_type type variables correct results . Default c("factor", "numeric", "numeric"). wide data wide format. Default TRUE. only_female female specific diseases. Default NULL. only_male male specific diseases. Default NULL. volcano Generate volcano plots. Default TRUE. pval_lim p-value limit significance. Default 0.05. logfc_lim logFC limit significance. Default 0. top_up_prot number top regulated proteins label plot. Default 40. top_down_prot number top regulated proteins label plot. Default 10. palette color palette plot. character, one palettes get_hpa_palettes(). Default "diff_exp". subtitle subtitle displayed. Default TRUE. save Save volcano plots. Default FALSE.

title: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
text: list differential expression results volcano plots. de_results: list differential expression results. volcano_plots: list volcano plots.

title: Run differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma
text: sex-specific diseases, correction Sex. performed automatically function.

title: Differential expression analysis with limma for continuous variable ‚Äî do_limma_continuous_de
text: join_data (tibble). tibble Olink data wide format joined metadata. variable (character). variable interest. pval_lim (numeric). p-value limit significance. Default 0.05. logfc_lim (numeric). logFC limit significance. Default 0.

title: Differential expression analysis with limma for continuous variable ‚Äî do_limma_continuous_de
text: de_res (tibble). tibble differential expression results.

what: Differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma_de
title: Differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma_de
text: do_limma_de() performs differential expression analysis using limma package. can correct results metadata columns like Sex, Age, BMI. output tibble includes logFC, p-values, well FDR adjusted p-values. function removes NAs columns used correct .

title: Differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma_de
code: do_limma_de(   join_data,   disease,   correct = c("Sex", "Age"),   correct_type = c("factor", "numeric", "numeric"),   only_female = NULL,   only_male = NULL,   pval_lim = 0.05,   logfc_lim = 0 )

title: Differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma_de
text: join_data tibble Olink data wide format joined metadata. disease disease interest. correct variables correct results . Default c("Sex", "Age"). correct_type type variables correct results . Default c("factor", "numeric"). only_female female specific diseases. Default NULL. only_male male specific diseases. Default NULL. pval_lim p-value limit significance. Default 0.05. logfc_lim logFC limit significance. Default 0.

title: Differential expression analysis with limma ‚Äî do_limma_de
text: tibble differential expression results.

title: Perform over-representation analysis ‚Äî do_ora
text: do_ora() performs -representation analysis (ORA) using clusterProfiler package. also produces useful plots visualize results.

title: Perform over-representation analysis ‚Äî do_ora
code: do_ora(gene_list, database = c("KEGG", "GO"))

title: Perform over-representation analysis ‚Äî do_ora
text: gene_list character vector containing gene names. database database perform ORA. can either "KEGG" "GO".

title: Perform over-representation analysis ‚Äî do_ora
text: list containing results ORA.

title: Perform over-representation analysis ‚Äî do_ora

title: Run PCA analysis ‚Äî do_pca
text: do_pca() runs PCA analysis provided data. function can visualize sample points first second PC plane well PCA loadings. can also save plots results directory.

title: Run PCA analysis ‚Äî do_pca
code: do_pca(   olink_data,   metadata = NULL,   color = "Disease",   palette = NULL,   wide = TRUE,   impute = TRUE,   plots = TRUE,   pcs = 4,   nproteins = 8,   save = FALSE )

title: Run PCA analysis ‚Äî do_pca
text: olink_data tibble data used PCA analysis. metadata tibble metadata information used PCA plots. Default NULL. color name column metadata contains variable. used plot points color. Default "Disease". palette color palette plot. character, one palettes get_hpa_palettes(). wide TRUE, data assumed wide format. Default TRUE. impute TRUE, data imputed PCA analysis. Default TRUE. plots TRUE, function creates plots PCA results. Default TRUE. pcs number PCs plotted. Default 4. nproteins number proteins plotted. Default 8. save TRUE, plots saved results directory. Default FALSE.

title: Run PCA analysis ‚Äî do_pca
text: list PCA results , requested, PCA plots. pca_res: tibble PCA results. loadings: tibble PCA loadings. pca_plot: ggplot object data points 1st 2nd PCs plane. loadings_plot: PCA loadings ggplot object.

title: Run PCA analysis ‚Äî do_pca

what: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf
title: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf
text: do_rf() runs random forest classification model pipeline. splits data training test sets, creates class-balanced case-control groups, fits model. also performs hyperparameter optimization, fits best model, tests , plots useful feature variable importance.

title: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf
code: do_rf(   olink_data,   metadata,   wide = TRUE,   only_female = NULL,   only_male = NULL,   exclude_cols = "Sex",   ratio = 0.75,   cv_sets = 5,   grid_size = 10,   ncores = 4,   hypopt_vis = TRUE,   palette = NULL,   vline = TRUE,   subtitle = c("accuracy", "sensitivity", "specificity", "auc", "features",     "top-features"),   nfeatures = 9,   points = T,   seed = 123 )

title: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf
text: olink_data Olink data. metadata Metadata. wide Whether data wide format. Default TRUE. only_female Vector diseases female specific. Default NULL. only_male Vector diseases male specific. Default NULL. exclude_cols Columns exclude data model tuned. Default "Sex". ratio Ratio training data test data. Default 0.75. cv_sets Number cross-validation sets. Default 5. grid_size Size hyperparameter optimization grid. Default 10. ncores Number cores use parallel processing. Default 4. hypopt_vis Whether visualize hyperparameter optimization results. Default TRUE. palette color palette plot. character, one palettes get_hpa_palettes(). Default NULL. vline Whether add vertical line 50% importance. Default TRUE. subtitle Vector subtitle elements include plot. Default list . nfeatures Number top features include boxplot. Default 9. points Whether add points boxplot. Default TRUE. seed Seed reproducibility. Default 123.

title: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf
text: list results disease. list contains: hypopt_res: Hyperparameter optimization results. finalfit_res: Final model fitting results. testfit_res: Test model fitting results. var_imp_res: Variable importance results.

title: Random forest classification model pipeline ‚Äî do_rf

what: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
title: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
text: do_ttest() performs differential expression analysis using t-test. separates data case-control groups, checks data normality perform t-test Wilcoxon test respectively. also performs p value FDR adjustment. can generate save volcano plots.

title: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
code: do_ttest(   olink_data,   metadata,   wide = TRUE,   only_female = NULL,   only_male = NULL,   volcano = TRUE,   pval_lim = 0.05,   logfc_lim = 0,   top_up_prot = 40,   top_down_prot = 10,   palette = "diff_exp",   subtitle = TRUE,   save = FALSE )

title: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
text: olink_data tibble Olink data wide format. metadata tibble metadata. wide data wide format. Default TRUE. only_female female specific diseases. Default NULL. only_male male specific diseases. Default NULL. volcano Generate volcano plots. Default TRUE. pval_lim p-value limit significance. Default 0.05. logfc_lim logFC limit significance. Default 0. top_up_prot number top regulated proteins label plot. Default 40. top_down_prot number top regulated proteins label plot. Default 10. palette color palette plot. character, one palettes get_hpa_palettes(). Default "diff_exp". subtitle subtitle displayed. Default TRUE. save Save volcano plots. Default FALSE.

title: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
text: list differential expression results volcano plots. de_results: list differential expression results. volcano_plots: list volcano plots.

title: Run differential expression analysis with t-test ‚Äî do_ttest
code: de_results <- do_ttest(example_data, example_metadata, wide = FALSE)  # Results for AML de_results$de_results$AML #> # A tibble: 100 √ó 6 #>    Assay    P.Value  logFC Disease     adj.P.Val sig              #>    <chr>      <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>           <dbl> <chr>            #>  1 ADA     2.52e-11  1.46  AML     0.00000000252 significant up   #>  2 ANGPT1  6.18e- 9 -1.70  AML     0.000000241   significant down #>  3 ANGPT2  7.24e- 9  0.795 AML     0.000000241   significant up   #>  4 APEX1   2.04e- 7  1.30  AML     0.00000511    significant up   #>  5 ADGRG1  7.43e- 7  1.27  AML     0.0000149     significant up   #>  6 APBB1IP 2.58e- 6  1.16  AML     0.0000390     significant up   #>  7 APP     2.73e- 6 -0.764 AML     0.0000390     significant down #>  8 AZU1    1.54e- 5  1.64  AML     0.000193      significant up   #>  9 AGRP    2.68e- 5  0.827 AML     0.000297      significant up   #> 10 ARTN    6.99e- 5  1.09  AML     0.000699      significant up   #> # ‚Ñπ 90 more rows  # Volcano plot for AML de_results$volcano_plots$AML

title: Run UMAP analysis ‚Äî do_umap
text: do_umap() runs UMAP analysis provided data. function can visualize sample points first second UMAP plane. can also save plots results directory.

title: Run UMAP analysis ‚Äî do_umap
code: do_umap(   olink_data,   metadata = NULL,   color = "Disease",   palette = NULL,   wide = TRUE,   impute = TRUE,   plots = TRUE,   save = FALSE )

title: Run UMAP analysis ‚Äî do_umap
text: olink_data tibble data used UMAP analysis. metadata tibble metadata information used UMAP plots. Default NULL. color name column metadata contains variable. used plot points color. Default "Disease". palette vector colors used UMAP plots. Default NULL. wide TRUE, data assumed wide format. Default TRUE. impute TRUE, data imputed UMAP analysis. Default TRUE. plots TRUE, function creates plots UMAP results. Default TRUE. save TRUE, plots saved results directory. Default FALSE.

title: Run UMAP analysis ‚Äî do_umap
text: list UMAP results , requested, UMAP plots. umap_res: tibble UMAP results. umap_plot: ggplot object data points 1st 2nd UMAPs plane.

what: Hyperparameter optimization for elastic net model ‚Äî elnet_hypopt
title: Hyperparameter optimization for elastic net model ‚Äî elnet_hypopt
text: elnet_hypopt() tunes elastic net model performs hyperparameter optimization. uses glmnet engine logistic regression tunes either penalty (Lasso Ridge) penalty mixture (Elastic Regression). hyperparameter optimization, uses grid_latin_hypercube() function dials package.

title: Hyperparameter optimization for elastic net model ‚Äî elnet_hypopt
code: elnet_hypopt(   train_data,   test_data,   disease,   type = "lasso",   cv_sets = 5,   grid_size = 10,   ncores = 4,   hypopt_vis = TRUE,   exclude_cols = NULL,   seed = 123 )

title: Hyperparameter optimization for elastic net model ‚Äî elnet_hypopt
text: train_data List training data sets make_groups(). test_data List testing data sets make_groups(). disease Disease predict. type Type regularization. Default "lasso". options "ridge" "elnet". cv_sets Number cross-validation sets. Default 5. grid_size Size hyperparameter optimization grid. Default 10. ncores Number cores use parallel processing. Default 4. hypopt_vis Whether visualize hyperparameter optimization results. Default TRUE. exclude_cols Columns exclude data model tuned. Default NULL. seed Seed reproducibility. Default 123.

title: Hyperparameter optimization for elastic net model ‚Äî elnet_hypopt
text: list five elements: elnet_tune: Hyperparameter optimization results. wf: Workflow object. train_set: Training set. test_set: Testing set. hyperopt_vis: Hyperparameter optimization plot.

title: Automated PubMed literature search ‚Äî literature_search

code: literature_search(prot_dis_list, max_articles = 10)

title: Automated PubMed literature search ‚Äî literature_search
text: prot_dis_list list proteins diseases. names list diseases elements vectors proteins. max_articles maximum number articles retrieve protein-disease pair. Default 10.

text: list tibbles. tibble contains articles found protein-disease pair.

text: disease gene names correct order query successful. example AML written "acute myeloid leukemia".

title: Automated PubMed literature search ‚Äî literature_search
code: # Prepare the list of protein-disease pairs prot_dis_list <- list("acute myeloid leukemia" = c("FLT3", "EPO"),                       "chronic lymphocytic leukemia" = c("PARP1", "FCER2"))  # Run the literature search lit_search_results <- literature_search(prot_dis_list, max_articles = 1) #> Searching for articles on FLT3 and acute myeloid leukemia #> Searching for articles on EPO and acute myeloid leukemia #> Searching for articles on PARP1 and chronic lymphocytic leukemia #> Searching for articles on FCER2 and chronic lymphocytic leukemia  # Results for FLT3 in acute myeloid leukemia lit_search_results[["acute myeloid leukemia"]][["FLT3"]] #>       pmid        First_author year                   journal #> 1 39073493 Arwanih, Elly Yanah 2024 Molecular biology reports #>                                                                                                                           title #> 1 Identification of a novel mutation of the FLT3 gene located on the juxtamembrane domain from acute myeloid leukemia patients.
